snippet: The move is part of market-oriented changes aimed at bolstering a shrinking economy, but prices are likely to rise.
abstract: Argentinian Pres Mauricio Macri moves to devalue country's currency in effort to revive sluggish economy; plan to spur sustainable growth could provoke tension among historically restive middle class, who will be forced to endure higher prices in short term; some accuse Macri of catering to his own upper class.
lead_paragraph: The move is part of market-oriented changes aimed at bolstering a shrinking economy, but prices are likely to rise.

headline.main: Argentina Set to Devalue Its Currency
headline.print_headline: Argentina Set to Devalue Its Currency
